original_content:
May 18


Today's Blessing

"In Him dwelleth all the fullness of the Godhead bodily. 

And ye are complete in Him."
<http://www.crossbooks.com/verse.asp?ref=Col+2%3A9-10> Colossians 2:9,10

All the attributes of Christ, as God and man, are at our disposal. All the
fullness of the Godhead, whatever that wonderful term may bring to mind, is
ours to make us complete. He cannot endow us with the attributes of Deity;
but He has done all that can be done, for He has made even His divine power
and Godhead subservient to our salvation.

He did it all-He Himself said it When He said on the cross-"It is finished"

Thank You Lord

Pastor Al
original_reflection_text: All the attributes of Christ, as God and man, are at our disposal. All the fullness of the Godhead, whatever that wonderful term may bring to mind, is ours to make us complete. He cannot endow us with the attributes of Deity; but He has done all that can be done, for He has made even His divine power and Godhead subservient to our salvation. He did it all-He Himself said it When He said on the cross-It is finished
original_verse_text: In Him dwelleth all the fullness of the Godhead bodily. And ye are complete in Him.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we stand in awe of the fullness of Christ, who is both fully God and fully man. In Your great love, You have made all the attributes of Your divine nature available to us, so that we may be complete and lack nothing. We are humbled that You would make Your very power and Godhead subservient to our salvation. Lord, help us to grasp the magnitude of this gift, and to live in the fullness of all that You have accomplished for us. Amen.
reflection: All the attributes of Christ, as God and man, are at our disposal. All the fullness of the Godhead, whatever that wonderful term may bring to mind, is ours to make us complete. He cannot endow us with the attributes of Deity; but He has done all that can be done, for He has made even His divine power and Godhead subservient to our salvation. He did it all-He Himself said it When He said on the cross-It is finished
subject: Fullness of Christ Completes Us
verse_text: In Him dwelleth all the fullness of the Godhead bodily. And ye are complete in Him.

original_content:
All have sinned and fall short of God's gracious standard. (Ro. 3:23)



Food for thought



Agreed-some sins seem bigger than others because their obvious consequences

Are much more serious. Murder for example seems to us to be worse than
hatred,

And adultery seems worse than pride. BUT this does not mean that because we
only

Commit "little" sins we deserve eternal life. ALL SINS makes us sinners,
AND ALL SINS

Cut us off from our holy God. .



So all sins lead to death-(because they disqualify us from living with God)
regardless

Of how great or small they seem. SO don't minimize "little" sins or
overrate "big"

Sins. They all separate us from God, But they all can be forgiven! ! !



Have a Blessed Lord's Day!



We are not living in (Glenwood, Mn.)

I have started Sunday Morning Services here.

We live in an apt. which has about 48 apts.

We love it here it is like we been here forever.

We are on the 3rd floor and our livingroom window

Faces the lake, which is only about 8 or 10 blocks away.
original_reflection_text: Agreed-some sins seem bigger than others because their obvious consequences Are much more serious. Murder for example seems to us to be worse than hatred, And adultery seems worse than pride. BUT this does not mean that because we only Commit "little" sins we deserve eternal life. ALL SINS makes us sinners, AND ALL SINS Cut us off from our holy God. So all sins lead to death-(because they disqualify us from living with God) regardless of how great or small they seem. SO don't minimize "little" sins or overrate "big" Sins. They all separate us from God, But they all can be forgiven!
original_verse_text: All have sinned and fall short of God's gracious standard.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that all sin, whether great or small, separates us from Your holy presence. We confess that we have all fallen short of Your glory, and that our righteous deeds are as filthy rags. Yet, we are grateful that Your Son, Jesus Christ, has paid the ultimate price for our sins, offering us the free gift of eternal life. Lord, help us to never minimize the gravity of our transgressions, but to cling to the hope found in Your unfailing love and grace. Amen.
reflection: Agreed-some sins seem bigger than others because their obvious consequences Are much more serious. Murder for example seems to us to be worse than hatred, And adultery seems worse than pride. BUT this does not mean that because we only Commit "little" sins we deserve eternal life. ALL SINS makes us sinners, AND ALL SINS Cut us off from our holy God. So all sins lead to death-(because they disqualify us from living with God) regardless of how great or small they seem. SO don't minimize "little" sins or overrate "big" Sins. They all separate us from God, But they all can be forgiven!
subject: Forgiveness for All Sins
verse_text: All have sinned and fall short of God's gracious standard.

original_content:
Today's Verse:



Show me Your unfailing love in wonderful ways.

You save with Your strength those who seek refuge 

From their enemies. Ps. 17:7



Food For Thought:



Yes God will save us-BUT let us not conclude, that we have somehow

missed God's protection if we experience troubles. God's protection has

far greater purposes than helping us avoid pain; it is to make us better

servants for Him. 

God also protects us by guiding us through painful circumstances, not

only by helping us escape them. .



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6
original_reflection_text: Yes God will save us-BUT let us not conclude, that we have somehow missed God's protection if we experience troubles. God's protection has far greater purposes than helping us avoid pain; it is to make us better servants for Him. God also protects us by guiding us through painful circumstances, not only by helping us escape them.
original_verse_text: Show me Your unfailing love in wonderful ways. You save with Your strength those who seek refuge From their enemies.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for Your steadfast love and faithful protection. Though we may face trials and tribulations, we trust that Your discipline is an expression of Your care, molding us into the servants You desire us to be. Grant us the wisdom to endure hardship with patience and faith, knowing that Your purposes are higher than our own. May we find comfort in Your abiding presence, even in the midst of life's challenges. Amen.
reflection: Yes God will save us-BUT let us not conclude, that we have somehow missed God's protection if we experience troubles. God's protection has far greater purposes than helping us avoid pain; it is to make us better servants for Him. God also protects us by guiding us through painful circumstances, not only by helping us escape them.
subject: Trusting God Through Troubles
verse_text: Show me Your unfailing love in wonderful ways. You save with Your strength those who seek refuge From their enemies.

original_content:
Verse for Today:



Our Father who art in Heaven. Lk. 11:2



Food for Thought:

How simple, and how beautiful, this invocation is which Christ puts upon our
lips!

And yet how inconceivably rich these words are in their meaning. How full of
the 

love and blessing they contain. .

Just think what a book could be written of all the memories that there are
on 

earth of wise and loving fathers. Just think of what this world owes to the
fathers who

have made their children strong and happy in giving their lives to seek the
welfare 

of their fellowmen. And then think how all this is but a shadow-a shadow of
beauty

beyond compare, but still but a shadow-of what the Father in heaven is to
His

children on earth. .

What a gift Christ bestowed upon us when He gave us the right to
say: "Father!"

"The Father of Christ!" "Our Father!" "My Father!" What a privilege is ours
when

we bow in worship to know that the our heavenly Father comes near to us
where we 

are upon the earth. What a wonderful gift! ! !



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"Shout for joy to the LORD, all the earth." Palsm 100-_1
original_reflection_text: How simple, and how beautiful, this invocation is which Christ puts upon our lips! And yet how inconceivably rich these words are in their meaning. How full of the love and blessing they contain. Just think what a book could be written of all the memories that there are on earth of wise and loving fathers. Just think of what this world owes to the fathers who have made their children strong and happy in giving their lives to seek the welfare of their fellowmen. And then think how all this is but a shadow-a shadow of beauty beyond compare, but still but a shadow-of what the Father in heaven is to His children on earth. What a gift Christ bestowed upon us when He gave us the right to say: "Father!" "The Father of Christ!" "Our Father!" "My Father!" What a privilege is ours when we bow in worship to know that the our heavenly Father comes near to us where we are upon the earth. What a wonderful gift!
original_verse_text: Our Father who art in Heaven.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, for You are the perfect and loving Father. We thank You for the privilege of calling You "Our Father" and for the assurance that You are near to us, Your children on earth. May Your name be hallowed, Your kingdom come, and Your will be done, as in heaven, so on earth. Guide us this day and forgive our sins, as we forgive those who sin against us. Lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil. For Yours is the kingdom and the power and the glory forever. Amen.
reflection: How simple, and how beautiful, this invocation is which Christ puts upon our lips! And yet how inconceivably rich these words are in their meaning. How full of the love and blessing they contain. Just think what a book could be written of all the memories that there are on earth of wise and loving fathers. Just think of what this world owes to the fathers who have made their children strong and happy in giving their lives to seek the welfare of their fellowmen. And then think how all this is but a shadow-a shadow of beauty beyond compare, but still but a shadow-of what the Father in heaven is to His children on earth. What a gift Christ bestowed upon us when He gave us the right to say: "Father!" "The Father of Christ!" "Our Father!" "My Father!" What a privilege is ours when we bow in worship to know that the our heavenly Father comes near to us where we are upon the earth. What a wonderful gift!
subject: The Father's Gift
verse_text: Our Father who art in Heaven.

original_content:
Today's Verse: Col. 2:1

(Paul's prayer for his people)

"I want you to know how much I have agonized for you and for the church at 

Laodicea, and for many other believers who have never met me personally."



Today's Lesson:

Something we may give very little thought to is: "Prayer is sacrifice."

Our prayer has its worth alone from being rooted in the sacrifice of

Jesus Christ. As He gave up everything in His prayer: "Thy will be done,"

Our posture and disposition must be the offering up of everything to

God in His service.

Need we wonder at the lack of power in our prayer where there is

So much reluctance to make the needful sacrifice in waiting upon

God?



Today's Prayer:

Dear Lord Jesus: help us to learn that the secret of powerful prayer

Is sacrifice-sacrifice of ease-of time-and of self. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Worship the LORD with gladness; 
come before him with joyful songs. Psalm 100:2
original_reflection_text: Something we may give very little thought to is: "Prayer is sacrifice. " Our prayer has its worth alone from being rooted in the sacrifice of Jesus Christ. As He gave up everything in His prayer: "Thy will be done, " Our posture and disposition must be the offering up of everything to God in His service. Need we wonder at the lack of power in our prayer where there is So much reluctance to make the needful sacrifice in waiting upon God?
original_verse_text: (Paul's prayer for his people) "I want you to know how much I have agonized for you and for the church at Laodicea, and for many other believers who have never met me personally.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, humbled by the sacrifice of Your Son, Jesus Christ. May our prayers be rooted in His selfless offering, as we seek to align our wills with Yours. Grant us the courage to surrender all to Your service, that our petitions may be empowered by the sacrifice of Christ. Guide us, Lord, to pray with a posture of complete devotion, that Your will may be done in our lives. Amen.
reflection: Something we may give very little thought to is: "Prayer is sacrifice. " Our prayer has its worth alone from being rooted in the sacrifice of Jesus Christ. As He gave up everything in His prayer: "Thy will be done, " Our posture and disposition must be the offering up of everything to God in His service. Need we wonder at the lack of power in our prayer where there is So much reluctance to make the needful sacrifice in waiting upon God?
subject: Sacrifice of Prayer
verse_text: (Paul's prayer for his people) "I want you to know how much I have agonized for you and for the church at Laodicea, and for many other believers who have never met me personally.

original_content:
Today's Verse: Ps. 138:8



The Lord will work out his plans for my life- for your faithful love,

O Lord, endures forever. Don't abandon me, for you made me.



Food for thought:

I believe every person dreams and makes plans for the future.

Then they work hard to make their dreams and plans come true.



But to make the most of life, we need to include God's plan in

Our plans. He alone knows what is best for us; He alone can

Fulfill His purpose for us. .



As you make plans and dream dreams-talk with God about it.



We've been asked how we are doing-well we love it here-but I'm

Waiting for the weather to straighten up so I can go fishing. Lake

Minnewaska is only 8 or 10 blocks away. Every time I look out the 

Living-room window I see the lake.



It's kind of like putting a bottle of booze in front of an alcoholic ha-ha



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"He says, "Be still, and know that I am God;" Psalm 46:10
original_reflection_text: I believe every person dreams and makes plans for the future. Then they work hard to make their dreams and plans come true. But to make the most of life, we need to include God's plan in Our plans. He alone knows what is best for us; He alone can Fulfill His purpose for us.
original_verse_text:
The Lord will work out his plans for my life- for your faithful love,

O Lord, endures forever. Don't abandon me, for you made me.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that our hearts and minds are often consumed with our own dreams and plans for the future. Yet, we recognize that Your ways are higher than our ways, and Your thoughts are greater than our thoughts. Lord, help us to surrender our plans to You, trusting that Your purpose for our lives is perfect and will be fulfilled, as Your Word declares in Proverbs 16:9. Guide us, we pray, that we may walk in the path You have set before us, for Your glory and our ultimate good. Amen.
reflection: I believe every person dreams and makes plans for the future. Then they work hard to make their dreams and plans come true. But to make the most of life, we need to include God's plan in Our plans. He alone knows what is best for us; He alone can Fulfill His purpose for us.
subject: Embrace God's Plan for Your Life
verse_text:
The Lord will work out his plans for my life- for your faithful love,

O Lord, endures forever. Don't abandon me, for you made me.

original_content:
Today's Verse: ." Ps. 66:17, 18, 19a

I cried out to Him for help, praising Him as I spoke.

If I had not confessed the sin in my heart, my Lord 

would not have listened-But God did listen!

Food for Thought:

Our confession of sin must be continual-because we continue to do wrong.

But true confession requires us to listen to God and want to stop doing what

Is wrong. .

David confessed his sin and prayed-"Cleanse me from these hidden faults,

Keep me from deliberate sins" (ps. 19:12, 13).

When we refuse to repent, or when we labor and cherish certain sins, we

Place a wall between us and God. We may not be able to remember every sin

We have committed, but our attitude should be one of confession and
obedience.

****************************************************************************

There are still some who do not know where "Glenwood" is.

It is about 15 miles south of Alexandrea Mn. 



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6
original_reflection_text: Our confession of sin must be continual-because we continue to do wrong. But true confession requires us to listen to God and want to stop doing what Is wrong. David confessed his sin and prayed -"Cleanse me from these hidden faults, Keep me from deliberate sins" (ps. 19:12, 13). When we refuse to repent, or when we labor and cherish certain sins, we Place a wall between us and God. We may not be able to remember every sin obedience.
original_verse_text: I cried out to Him for help, praising Him as I spoke. If I had not confessed the sin in my heart, my Lord would not have listened-But God did listen!
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging our continual need for Your forgiveness and cleansing. We confess our sins, both hidden and deliberate, and ask that You would purify us from all unrighteousness. Grant us the grace to listen to Your voice, turn away from our wrongdoings, and walk in obedience to Your will. May our lives be a reflection of Your transforming power. Amen.
reflection: Our confession of sin must be continual-because we continue to do wrong. But true confession requires us to listen to God and want to stop doing what Is wrong. David confessed his sin and prayed -"Cleanse me from these hidden faults, Keep me from deliberate sins" (ps. 19:12, 13). When we refuse to repent, or when we labor and cherish certain sins, we Place a wall between us and God. We may not be able to remember every sin obedience.
subject: Continual Confession Leads to Cleansing
verse_text: I cried out to Him for help, praising Him as I spoke. If I had not confessed the sin in my heart, my Lord would not have listened-But God did listen!

original_content:
Today's Verse: Ro. 12:3b

Don't think you are better than you really are. Be honest in your evaluation
of yourselves,

measuring yourselves by the faith God has given us. .



Today's thought:

Healthy self-esteem is important because some of us think too little of
ourselves; on the other hand.

Some of us over-estimate ourselves-the key to an honest and accurate
self-evaluation is knowing

the basis of our self-worth-our identity in Christ. .



Apart from Him, we aren't capable of very much by eternal standards; in Him,
we are valuable and 

capable of worthy service. .



Evaluating ourselves by the worldly standards of success and achievements
can cause us to think too

much about our worth in the eyes of others and so miss our true value in
God's eyes. .

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"He says, "Be still, and know that I am God;" Psalm 46:10
original_reflection_text: Healthy self-esteem is important because some of us think too little of ourselves; on the other hand. Some of us overestimate ourselves-the key to an honest and accurate self-evaluation is knowing the basis of our self-worth-our identity in Christ. Apart from Him, we aren't capable of very much by eternal standards; in Him, capable of worthy service. Evaluating ourselves by the worldly standards of success and achievements can cause us to think too much about our worth in the eyes of others and so miss our true value in God's eyes.
original_verse_text: Don't think you are better than you really are. Be honest in your evaluation of yourselves, measuring yourselves by the faith God has given us.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that our true worth and identity are found in You alone. Help us to see ourselves as You see us - Your beloved children, created for good works that You have prepared in advance for us to do. May we not compare ourselves to the world's standards, but instead, humbly accept the measure of faith You have given us. Guide us to serve You faithfully, using the gifts and talents You have graciously bestowed upon us. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Healthy self-esteem is important because some of us think too little of ourselves; on the other hand. Some of us overestimate ourselves-the key to an honest and accurate self-evaluation is knowing the basis of our self-worth-our identity in Christ. Apart from Him, we aren't capable of very much by eternal standards; in Him, capable of worthy service. Evaluating ourselves by the worldly standards of success and achievements can cause us to think too much about our worth in the eyes of others and so miss our true value in God's eyes.
subject: Discover Your True Worth
verse_text: Don't think you are better than you really are. Be honest in your evaluation of yourselves, measuring yourselves by the faith God has given us.

original_content:
Today's Verse: 55:6 

Seek the Lord while you can find him. Call on him now while he is near.



Thoughts to live by:

Isaiah tells us to call on the Lord while he is near. God is not planning to
move away 

from us, but we often move far from Him or erect barriers of sin between us.




Don't wait until you have drifted far away from God to seek Him. Turning to
Him

may be far more difficult later in life. Or God may come to judge the earth
before

you decide to turn to Him. Seek God now, while you can, before it is too
late. .



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"Shout for joy to the LORD, all the earth." Palsm 100-_1
original_reflection_text: Isaiah tells us to call on the Lord while he is near. God is not planning to move away from us, but we often move far from Him or erect barriers of sin between us. Don't wait until you have drifted far away from God to seek Him. Turning to Him may be far more difficult later in life. Or God may come to judge the earth before you decide to turn to Him. Seek God now, while you can, before it is too late. .
original_verse_text: Seek the Lord while you can find him. Call on him now while he is near.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we humbly come before You, seeking Your presence and guidance. As Your word in Isaiah reminds us, may we not delay in calling upon Your name, for You are near and ready to be found. Help us, Lord, to wholeheartedly seek You, as Jeremiah's words encourage, that we may draw close to You and experience the fullness of Your love and grace. Forgive us for the times we have drifted from You, and empower us by Your Spirit to remain steadfast in our pursuit of You. May we never take for granted the opportunity to know and walk with You. Amen.
reflection: Isaiah tells us to call on the Lord while he is near. God is not planning to move away from us, but we often move far from Him or erect barriers of sin between us. Don't wait until you have drifted far away from God to seek Him. Turning to Him may be far more difficult later in life. Or God may come to judge the earth before you decide to turn to Him. Seek God now, while you can, before it is too late. .
subject: Seek God While He is Near
verse_text: Seek the Lord while you can find him. Call on him now while he is near.

original_content:
Today's Verse: Ro. 11:34, 35 

For who can know the Lord's thoughts? Who knows enough to give him advice?
And who has given him so much that he needs to pay it back?



Today's Thoughts:

The implication of these questions is that no one has fully understood the
mind

of the Lord. No one has been His counselor. And God owes nothing to anyone

of us. .

Isaiah and Jeremiah asked similar questions to show that we are unable to
give

advise to God or criticize His ways (Isa 40:13) Jer. 23:18. .



God alone is the possessor of absolute power and absolute wisdom. .



My prayer is that you all had a safe and blessed Memorial Day.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6
original_reflection_text: The implication of these questions is that no one has fully understood the mind of the Lord. No one has been His counselor. And God owes nothing to anyone of us. Isaiah and Jeremiah asked similar questions to show that we are unable to give advise to God or criticize His ways (Isaiah 40:13) Jeremiah 23:18. God alone is the possessor of absolute power and absolute wisdom.
original_verse_text: For who can know the Lord's thoughts? Who knows enough to give him advice? And who has given him so much that he needs to pay it back?
prayer: Heavenly Father, we stand in awe of Your infinite wisdom and sovereignty. Your ways are beyond our understanding, and we humbly acknowledge that we cannot counsel You or demand anything from You. You are the source of all knowledge and the possessor of absolute power. We submit to Your perfect plan, trusting that Your judgments are righteous and Your mercies are unfailing. May we ever seek to know You more, rather than presuming to know the fullness of Your mind. To You be all glory and praise, now and forever. Amen.
reflection: The implication of these questions is that no one has fully understood the mind of the Lord. No one has been His counselor. And God owes nothing to anyone of us. Isaiah and Jeremiah asked similar questions to show that we are unable to give advise to God or criticize His ways (Isaiah 40:13) Jeremiah 23:18. God alone is the possessor of absolute power and absolute wisdom.
subject: Absolute Power, Absolute Wisdom
verse_text: For who can know the Lord's thoughts? Who knows enough to give him advice? And who has given him so much that he needs to pay it back?

original_content:
Today's Verse: Romans 8:30
<http://www.crossbooks.com/verse.asp?ref=Ro+8%3A30> Whom He justified,
them He also glorified



Today's Promise:

Here is a precious truth for the believer. You may be poor, or in suffering,
or unknown, but there is encouragement for you if you review your "calling."
As surely as you are God's child today, so surely shall all your trials soon
be at an end, and you shall be rich to all the intents of God's grace. 

Wait awhile, and that weary head shall wear the crown of glory, and that
hand of labor shall grasp the palm-branch of victory. Don't cry over your
troubles, but instead rejoice that one day you will be where "there shall be
neither sorrow, nor crying, neither shall there be any more pain."

Remember the portals of heaven stand open for you. If He has called you,
nothing can separate you from His love. Distress cannot sever the bond; the
fire of persecution cannot burn the link; the hammer of hell cannot break
the chain. You are secure; that voice which called you at first, shall call
you yet again from earth to heaven, from death's dark gloom to immortality's
unuttered splendors.

Rest assured, the heart of Him who has justified you beats with infinite
love towards you. You shall soon be with the glorified, where your portion
is.



Prayer: Dear Lord, we look forward to the day when from this world of
grief and sin,

we will be united with You and be eternally shut-in-where we will rest
for 

ever and ever. .Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6

."
original_reflection_text: Here is a precious truth for the believer. You may be poor, or in suffering, or unknown, but there is encouragement for you if you review your "calling." As surely as you are God's child today, so surely shall all your trials soon be at an end, and you shall be rich to all the intents of God's grace. Wait awhile, and that weary head shall wear the crown of glory, and that hand of labor shall grasp the palm-branch of victory. Don't cry over your troubles, but instead rejoice that one day you will be where "there shall be neither sorrow, nor crying, neither shall there be any more pain." Remember the portals of heaven stand open for you. If He has called you, nothing can separate you from His love. Distress cannot sever the bond; the fire of persecution cannot burn the link; the hammer of hell cannot break the chain. You are secure; that voice which called you at first, shall call you yet again from earth to heaven, from death's dark gloom to immortality's unuttered splendors. Rest assured, the heart of Him who has justified you beats with infinite love towards you. You shall soon be with the glorified, where your portion is
original_verse_text: Whom He justified, them He also glorified.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the precious truth that as Your children, our trials and sorrows will one day come to an end. We rejoice in the promise that in Your eternal kingdom, there will be no more sorrow, crying, or pain. Lord, we trust that the bond of Your love cannot be broken, and that the voice that called us will one day call us home to the splendors of heaven. May we rest secure in Your infinite love, as we await the day when we shall be with the glorified. Amen.
reflection: Here is a precious truth for the believer. You may be poor, or in suffering, or unknown, but there is encouragement for you if you review your "calling." As surely as you are God's child today, so surely shall all your trials soon be at an end, and you shall be rich to all the intents of God's grace. Wait awhile, and that weary head shall wear the crown of glory, and that hand of labor shall grasp the palm-branch of victory. Don't cry over your troubles, but instead rejoice that one day you will be where "there shall be neither sorrow, nor crying, neither shall there be any more pain." Remember the portals of heaven stand open for you. If He has called you, nothing can separate you from His love. Distress cannot sever the bond; the fire of persecution cannot burn the link; the hammer of hell cannot break the chain. You are secure; that voice which called you at first, shall call you yet again from earth to heaven, from death's dark gloom to immortality's unuttered splendors. Rest assured, the heart of Him who has justified you beats with infinite love towards you. You shall soon be with the glorified, where your portion is
subject: Your Eternal Calling Awaits
verse_text: Whom He justified, them He also glorified.

original_content:
Today's Verse: Col. 4:2 Devote yourselves to prayer with an alert mind and
a thankful heart.



Today's Message:

This is not the work of one day or one night. It needs to be one with the
will to take the time to 

do some serious thinking in regard to the state and the need of the body of
Christ in which we

belong. .

BUT once we begin, we will find numerous reasons for the persevering and
yielding to the Holy

Spirit-that He may fit us for the great and blessed work of day by day
praying the twofold prayer, 

for the love of God and Christ to fill the hearts of His people and for the
power of the Holy Spirit

to come down and accomplish God's work in this sinful world. .



Prayer:

Dear Lord, may we devote ourselves to daily prayer-Fill our hearts with a
love for God and ChristSend to us the power of the Holy Spirit to be able to accomplish Your work
in this sinful world. Amen





Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"Shout for joy to the LORD, all the earth." Palsm 100-:1
original_reflection_text: This is not the work of one day or one night. It needs to be one with the will to take the time to do some serious thinking in regard to the state and the need of the body of Christ in which we belong. BUT once we begin, we will find numerous reasons for the persevering and yielding to the Holy Spirit-that He may fit us for the great and blessed work of day by day praying the twofold prayer, for the love of God and Christ to fill the hearts of His people and for the power of the Holy Spirit to come down and accomplish God's work in this sinful world.
original_verse_text:
Devote yourselves to prayer with an alert mind and
a thankful heart.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with hearts filled with the desire to persevere in prayer. Grant us the wisdom and the will to take the time to seek Your will for the state and the need of the body of Christ. May Your love and the power of the Holy Spirit fill our hearts, that we may be equipped to do Your work in this sinful world. We yield ourselves to You, Lord, that Your purposes may be accomplished. Amen.
reflection: This is not the work of one day or one night. It needs to be one with the will to take the time to do some serious thinking in regard to the state and the need of the body of Christ in which we belong. BUT once we begin, we will find numerous reasons for the persevering and yielding to the Holy Spirit-that He may fit us for the great and blessed work of day by day praying the twofold prayer, for the love of God and Christ to fill the hearts of His people and for the power of the Holy Spirit to come down and accomplish God's work in this sinful world.
subject: Persevere in Prayerful Yielding
verse_text:
Devote yourselves to prayer with an alert mind and
a thankful heart.

original_content:
Today's Scripture: Ro 10:9-10

If you confess with your mouth that Jesus is Lord and believe in your heart
that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.
For it is by believing in your heart that you are made right with God, and
it is by confessing with your mouth that you are saved



Today's Lesson:

Have you ever been asked-"How do I become a Christian?" These verse give you
a beautiful answer.

Salvation is as close as your lips and your heart. It seems as though many
people think it must be a 

Complicated proccess, but it is not. 

If we believe in our heart, and say with our mouth that Christ is the risen
Lord. We will be saved.



As we grow-A Christian should beA mind through which Christ thinksA voice through which Christ speaksA heart through which Christ lovesA hand through which Christ helps. .



Have a blessed week end! ! !



I will be away from the computor for five days

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Worship the LORD with gladness; 
come before him with joyful songs. Psalm 100:2
original_reflection_text: Have you ever been asked-"How do I become a Christian?" These verse give you a beautiful answer. Salvation is as close as your lips and your heart. It seems as though many people think it must be a complicated process, but it is not. If we believe in our heart, and say with our mouth that Christ is the risen Lord. We will be saved. As we grow - A Christian should be a mind through which Christ thinks a voice through which Christ speaks a heart through which Christ loves a hand through which Christ helps.
original_verse_text: If you confess with your mouth that Jesus is Lord and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved. For it is by believing in your heart that you are made right with God, and it is by confessing with your mouth that you are saved.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, for Your gift of salvation is simple yet profound. We believe in our hearts that Jesus Christ is the risen Lord, and we confess this truth with our lips. May our lives reflect the transformative power of Your love, as we strive to be the mind, voice, heart, and hands through which Christ works in this world. Guide us, Lord, to live out our faith with sincerity and purpose, that others may see Your light shining through us. Amen.
reflection: Have you ever been asked-"How do I become a Christian?" These verse give you a beautiful answer. Salvation is as close as your lips and your heart. It seems as though many people think it must be a complicated process, but it is not. If we believe in our heart, and say with our mouth that Christ is the risen Lord. We will be saved. As we grow - A Christian should be a mind through which Christ thinks a voice through which Christ speaks a heart through which Christ loves a hand through which Christ helps.
subject: Believe, Confess, be Saved
verse_text: If you confess with your mouth that Jesus is Lord and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved. For it is by believing in your heart that you are made right with God, and it is by confessing with your mouth that you are saved.
